Package mvc.view

Interface GraphicsStockView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleGraphicsStockView
    public interface GraphicsStockView
    The GraphicsStockView interface defines operations and methods for graphical user interfaces (views) for the stock program.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void displayError​(java.lang.String error)
      The displayError method displays an error popup with the given error message.
      void displayMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      The displayMessage method displays the given string to the output box in the view.
      java.lang.String getBuySellPortfolioCommand()
      The getBuySellPortfolioCommand method returns the desired portfolio the user chose to operate on for the buy/sell functionality.
      java.time.LocalDate getBuySellStockDateCommand()
      The getBuySellStockDateCommand returns the date as entered by the user for the buy/sell functionality.
      java.lang.String getCreatePortfolioNameCommand()
      The getCreatePortfolioNameCommand method returns the name of the desired portfolio as entered by the user in the create new portfolio window.
      java.lang.String getLoadPortfolioCommand()
      The getLoadPortfolioCommand method returns the desired portfolio the user chose to operate on for the load a portfolio functionality.
      java.lang.String getSavePortfolioCommand()
      The getSavePortfolioCommand method returns the desired portfolio the user chose to operate on for the save a portfolio functionality.
      double getStockSharesCommand()
      The getStockSharesCommand method returns the number of shares to buy/sell as entered by the user for the buy/sell functionality.
      java.lang.String getStockTickerCommand()
      The getStockTickerCommand method return the stock ticker for the desired stock as entered by the user for the buy/sell functionality.
      java.lang.String getValuePortfolioCommand()
      The getValuePortfolioCommand method returns the desired portfolio the user chose to operate on for the value of a portfolio functionality.
      java.time.LocalDate getValueStockDateCommand()
      The getValueStockDateCommand returns the date as entered by the user for the value of a portfolio functionality.
      void makeVisible()
      The makeVisible makes the current view visible.
      void refresh()
      The refresh method refreshes the view and updates the visuals.
      void setActivePortfolios​(java.lang.String[] portfolioNames)
      The setActivePortfolios method tells the view which portfolios are active in the model's portfolio manager.
      void setListeners​(java.awt.event.ActionListener actionEvent)
      The setListeners method passes this controller to the view and sets the controller as the action-listener for all the buttons in the view.
      void setSavedPortfolios​(java.lang.String[] portfolioNames)
      The setSavedPortfolios method tells the view which portfolios are in the local "portfolios" directory and are availible to be loaded.

    • Method Detail

        The makeVisible makes the current view visible.

        The getStockSharesCommand method returns the number of shares to buy/sell as entered by the user for the buy/sell functionality.
        Returns:
        the number of shares as a double

      • refresh

        void refresh()
        The refresh method refreshes the view and updates the visuals.

      • setActivePortfolios

        void setActivePortfolios​(java.lang.String[] portfolioNames)
        The setActivePortfolios method tells the view which portfolios are active in the model's portfolio manager.
        Parameters:
        portfolioNames - the names of active portfolios

      • setSavedPortfolios

        void setSavedPortfolios​(java.lang.String[] portfolioNames)
        The setSavedPortfolios method tells the view which portfolios are in the local "portfolios" directory and are availible to be loaded.
        Parameters:
        portfolioNames - the names of the portfolios in the local directory

      • setListeners

        void setListeners​(java.awt.event.ActionListener actionEvent)
        The setListeners method passes this controller to the view and sets the controller as the action-listener for all the buttons in the view.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the listener (controller)
